result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demarius D Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demarius D Johnson in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Demarius D Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court vacates stayed warrant. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Demarius D Johnson not in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Demarius D Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 15.
Calendar call scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demarius D Johnson in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demarius D Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for a Status Conference. Discussion held. Defendant has a pending matter (21CM3620) before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Proposed Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. State's Witness List

Defendant Demarius D Johnson in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.  Defense in receipt of discovery and requests time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-12-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Demarius D Johnson in court.  Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini under the supervision of Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is reassigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19 due to the Defendant's lower pending matter.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/10/2022@1:30p
